title: Legend Of The Lake
opening: Without a Crest or a family fortune, Leonie has a difficult time getting her hands on quality gear. Linhardt offers her a hint about a sacred weapon anyone can wield.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Not bad at all, if I do say so myself.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: I see needles and thread. What has you engaging in the textile arts, Leonie?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Patching up a hole in my equipment bag. Take a look. What do you think?

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: If your objective is merely to block up the hole, then I believe you've performed quite adequate work.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You might need a new one.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: I'm not going to throw away something I can still use. I can't afford to be wasteful.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Maybe you should ask for help next time.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Blocking the hole was all I cared about, so this suits me just fine.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Yes, but your bag is less bag and more a collection of dirty, smelly patches.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Smelly, huh? I don't smell anything.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: That aside, don't you have an allowance from your house to make purchases?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: No, nothing. Worse than that, actually. I'm in debt. I could only afford the Officers Academy because everyone in my village donated.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: The tuition is that expensive?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: It's not just that. In the Alliance, you have to pay the nobles as well in order to secure recommendations. Commoners can only get an education by borrowing money. It's pretty stupid. Not sure what makes the nobles think they've got the right to– Oh, sorry, Linhardt. Forgot you're a noble.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: If one is in a family that bears a Crest, then you're going to stand atop the social pecking order. I'd raise the topic with the goddess. She handed out Crests to the nobles after all.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Just handed them out, huh? You make it sound pretty casual.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: By the way, I have a weapon to recommend. It should suit a commoner such as yourself.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: That so? I just told you I don't have a lot of money.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: You're not going to buy it from a merchant. If you find it, you can keep it for free.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Now you've got my attention.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: There's a legend I read recently about Saint Indech, one of the Four Saints of the Church of Seiros.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Uh-huh? Keep talking.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Sorry... Suddenly very sleepy. Nap time calls.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Hey, come on! You can't just doze off in the middle of a story!

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Long story short, there's a holy weapon hidden in Lake Teutates that you can use even without a Crest...

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Lake Teutates? Right. Let's go, Professor!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Me?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: What's with that look? Don't you want to help your lovely students?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Lovely?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Yeah. Me and Linhardt. Aren't we just the cutest?

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Leave me be. I'm off to nap.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: We'll never find it unless you're there. If you're really that tired, we'll just have to carry you.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm not sure I want to carry him.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: We'll bring more people. We'll take turns. Come on, Professor. You're coming, right?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I will.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: If we're going now, I do suggest leaving Edelgard and Hubert innocent of our quest. Lake Teutates is a place that concerns the saints of the Church of Seiros. It may become bothersome should the two of them find out...

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: I'm not fond of keeping secrets from friends, but I guess we can tell them when we get back.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: All right, let's go find this thing!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Maybe later.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Ah, well. Guess it's just you and me, Linhardt.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Zzz...

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Let me know if you change your mind, Professor. Looks like I might be waiting here a bit.

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Linhardt! Wake up! We've reached Lake Teutates!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: Huh? What? Oh, um. Yes. So we have.

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: A temple on a lake, huh? Looks fancy. And that's a cute...uh...guard dog?

battle.speaker: The Immovable
battle.line: Guard dog? Is it I to whom you are referring?

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Whoa! A magic beast! And it talks!

battle.speaker: The Immovable
battle.line: Nuisance... You weaklings should turn tail and run!

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Uh, hi! We're actually, um, looking for something...

battle.speaker: The Immovable
battle.line: I know well what it is that you desire. If you want it, you must first complete my trial.

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: Of course we do. This is as awful as I expected. Perhaps we could go home now?

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Are you kidding? It's just a little fog! Come on, let's go talk to Mr. Magic Beast!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: I suspect our opponent is an illusion. If we cut off the source of this magic, they should stop attacking.

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: Fine. Defeat me, and show me what you are capable of!

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: Could you be the incarnation of Sothis? Interesting... Let's test your mettle!

boss.speaker: Linhardt
boss.line: We'll fight, but your form and mannerisms suggest that you might be...

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: If you want your wish to be granted, it is better that you fight me in ignorance.

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Hey, Mr. Magic Beast! If we defeat you, will you grant our wish?

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Great! I may not have a Crest, but I'll give it my all!

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: You are an interesting young girl... I accept your challenge.

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: You seem to be holding back. Thank you for that.

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: Hmph. Do not flatter me. My power is not what it once was. The best I can do nowadays is to have fun meddling with humans who wander in here.

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: I see. We were hoping you might help us, but is seems that may be too difficult.

boss.speaker: The Immovable
boss.line: Oh! You're here too! I've always wanted to meet you, Ceth–

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: I ask that you keep quiet, Uncle!

end.speaker: The Immovable
end.line: You did well. The trial ends here... What sublime children of men... Go ahead. Name your desire.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: So, uh, we heard you're giving away free weapons?

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Do be quiet, Leonie. Somewhere in this temple is said to rest the holy bow of Saint Indech. It is called "the Inexhaustible." Could you find it in your heart to let my friend here have it?

end.speaker: The Immovable
end.line: You have shown might deserving of my sacred bow. I will grant your wish.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: Yes! Thanks, Mr. Magic Beast!

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Aren't you happy, Leonie? That's quite a bow, and it was completely free.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I'll say. I've never seen anything like it. But is it really OK for me to take this?

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: I would say so, wouldn't you? After all, you went through an awful lot to get it.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I know, but... Professor, maybe you should hold on to it for me. At least for a while.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why me?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's yours, Leonie.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: It's not a weapon just anyone can use. I can see that. I want to be more confident in my strength before I really call it my own. Even holding it right now makes me feel unworthy. I'd really appreciate you looking after it for me.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I understand.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: Thanks, Professor. And everyone else who helped me too. I'm really grateful. Linhardt, I'm sorry I forced you to come along. But seeing such a kind-hearted person like you... Well, let's just say my opinion of the nobility's shifted a bit.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: I'm not sure I completely understand, Leonie, but it sounds like praise, so I will take it as such.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: Now, let's get back to work! I need all the training I can get!

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: She already possessed the strength to use that bow... She went through the trouble of fighting a saint so she could claim that weapon as her own.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A saint?

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Or maybe you'd call it a saintly beast. In any case...

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: When the time is right, can you fill in Edelgard about what happened?

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Oh, and please do let me use that bow. It's not exactly a Hero's Relic, but it is still rather fascinating, isn't it? I would love to learn to what extent the bow's connection to the Crest influences the weapon and perhaps even... Oh, it's been too much of a day, hasn't it? I'm feeling tired, so let's talk about this later. Good night.
